text: In mathematics, the Frölicher spectral sequence (often misspelled as Fröhlicher) is a tool in the theory of complex manifolds, for expressing the potential failure of the results of cohomology theory that are valid in general only for Kähler manifolds. It was introduced by . A spectral sequence is set up, the degeneration of which would give the results of Hodge theory and Dolbeault's theorem. ==See also== * Hodge–de Rham spectral sequence ==References== * Category:Complex manifolds Category:Spectral sequences
title: Frölicher spectral sequence
